name: Python Portscanner
tagline: A mass-target portscanner written in python
body:
Python Portscanner V0.3-beta === About --- My first Python Project.
Current version is more than basic... How to use --- 1.- Download all and extract it into an empty directory.
2.- Execute the main.py script with the python interpreter with the syntax "main.py x.x.x" where x.x.x is the IP range you want to scan (this is: 192.168.1 will scan your LAN for exemple) Some information about the script --- * Current version scans all IPs from x.x.x.1 to x.x.x.255
* A file with a list of the results is saved in the same directory than the scripts.
* The script creates temporary files in /tmp/, wich means that it only works on OS X and Linux Systems (windows compatibility coming soon). The tmp-files should be deleted automaticly at the end of the script, if not, Unix will delete them at the next boot. Contact --- Message me via Jabber: 5tream@dukgo.com
Drop an eMail: admin@7base.net Changelog --- - V0.3-beta Allmost the same as V0.2 but with some fixes. First 'real' release - V0.2 User input now posible. Improved report output - V0.1 Initial upload
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
